messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1533
messages.msgSnippet: ... Leslie, When I wanted to learn about e-bay, here is what I did. I took one small item that was not important and used it as a test sale. Walking through
messages.messageBody:
> Date: Thu, 11 Oct 2001 12:10:10 -0400
> From: "Leslie" <leslie@...>
> Subject: Re: Re: Bookselling
>
> Thanks Karri,
> I've got this page and I understand? most of the procedure but I
> can't find how much the seller is charged to use the service. Is it
> a flat fee? Are you only charged if the item sells?
> Thanks, Leslie

Leslie,

When I wanted to learn about e-bay, here is what I did.
I took one small item that was not important and used it as a test sale.
Walking through the process with something that was pretty
inconsequential was very helpful.
If I remember correctly, there was a listing fee for each item in the
neighborhood of 25 cents. There were other fees and you will see what
they are as you walk through the process.

Good Luck,

Bridget



^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Tyranny of the majority is tyranny nonetheless.
